[[Image:Runestone Pin.png|thumb|right|200px|A map showing the location of Runestone on the continent of Westeros.]]
'''Runestone''' is a castle in the [[Vale of Arryn]]. It is the seat of [[House Royce]], a vassal house holding fealty to [[House Arryn]] of [[the Eyrie]]. The castle is located east of the Eyrie, on the coast of the [[Narrow Sea]]. It is north of the city port of [[Gulltown]].<ref>[http://viewers-guide.hbo.com/game-of-thrones/season1/#!/locations/runestone/ HBO viewers guide, season 1 map, Runestone entry]</ref><ref>[http://viewers-guide.hbo.com/game-of-thrones/season2/#!/locations/the-vale-of-arryn/ HBO viewers guide, season 2 map, The Vale of Arryn entry]</ref>
sections.In the books:
In the ''[[A Song of Ice and Fire]]'' novels, Runestone is the stronghold of the famous Lord 'Bronze' [[Yohn Royce]], a mighty warrior noted for his loyalty to the late Lord [[Jon Arryn]].

Runestone is the home of Ser [[Waymar Royce]], a young [[knight]] who joined the [[Night's Watch]] but was slain [[beyond the Wall]] by the [[White Walkers|Others]], kicking off the events of both the books and TV series.
